column2: WASHINGTON DMV PRACTICE TEST
column6: WA

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: the speed limit on that route.
column6: the type of route you are on.
column8: that the route you are on might be dangerous.
column10: how many miles are left before you reach your destination.

column2: 2. This sign means:
column4: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.
column6: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
column8: The recommended speed limit is 45 MPH.
column10: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.

column2: 3. A flashing red light:
column4: means the same thing as a stop sign.
column6: is used at dangerous intersections.
column8: means that you must bring your vehicle to a complete halt.

column2: 4. This road sign means that:
column4: Workers are on or very close to the road in the work zone ahead.
column6: There is a children's playground ahead.
column8: There is a pedestrian crosswalk ahead.
column10: A group of prison workers is ahead.

column2: 5. This road sign:
column6: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
column8: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.
column10: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.

column2: 6. BAC is expressed in:
column6: ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column8: percentage of blood to alcohol.

column2: 7. Drivers shoul be cautious when large trucks make turns because:
column4: they have to back before making the turn.
column6: they may stop and flash their brake lights during the turn.
column8: they make wide turns and may cross the center line.
column10: None of the other answers are correct.

column2: 8. The yield sign means:
column4: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.
column6: Stop if you can.
column8: Stop.
column10: Go. The light will soon be red.

column2: 9. Drivers must dim their high beam headlights when within _____  of an oncoming vehicle.
column6: 500 feet
column8: 250 feet

column2: 10. When making a left or right turn in a business or residential district, you should activate your turn signal for:
column4: not less than 75 feet before turning.
column6: not less than 100 feet before turning.
column8: not less than 50 feet after turning.
column10: not less than 50 feet before turning.

column2: 11. To safely stop in emergencies always allow a space cushion of at least:
column4: 1 second behind the vehicle in front of you.
column6: 5 seconds behind the vehicle in front of you.
column8: 4 seconds behind the vehicle in front of you.
column10: 7 seconds behind the vehicle in front of you.

column2: 12. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: can turn left. You have the right of way.
column6: must make a U-turn and then turn right.
column8: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.
column10: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.

column2: 13. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column6: Report aggressive drivers to law enforcement authorities.
column8: Remain calm and relaxed.

column2: 14. Roads are most slippery:
column6: when it stops raining.
column8: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 15. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
column6: green lights.
column8: red warning lights.

column2: 16. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a winding road ahead.
column6: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column8: there is a low place in the road.
column10: there is a double curve ahead.

column2: 17. Bicyclists must:
column4: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.
column6: remain near the left edge of the road.
column8: travel with more than two side-by-side in a single lane, if possible.
column10: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.

column2: 18. Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
column6: red, green and yellow
column8: green, red and yellow

column2: 19. An octagonal sign means that drivers must:
column6: slow down.
column8: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 20. When riding at night, bicycles must have a white headlight visible for ____ feet.
21. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column6: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.
column8: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.

column2: 22. To enter a freeway:
column4: make a complete stop before entering the freeway.
column6: drive slowly so you can check traffic.
column8: signal and enter the freeway. You have the right-of-way.
column10: signal, yield, and enter at the same speed that traffic is moving.

column2: 23. When there are no signs or lane markings to control turning, drivers should:
column6: turn from any lane.
column8: turn from the lane that’s closest to the direction they want to go.

column2: 24. Don’t park within _____ feet of a fire hydrant.
25. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.
column6: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.
column8: Call an ambulance.

column2: 26. You can pass on the right:
column4: when passing is restricted by parked cars.
column6: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.
column8: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.
column10: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.

column2: 27. This sign indicates:
column4: Double curve ahead. Slow your speed.
column6: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column8: Winding road. Drive with caution.

column2: 28. If you refuse to take a BAC test when asked by an officer, you will lose your driver license for at least:
column6: 1 year.
column8: 6 months.

column2: 29. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
column6: pavement-planing.
column8: rideplaning.

column2: 30. This is:
column6: a merging traffic sign.
column8: a reduction of lanes sign.

column2: 31. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column6: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column8: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column10: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 32. This road sign means:
column4: Road construction ahead. Detour to the left.
column6: Blind intersection ahead.
column8: One-way street ahead.
column10: Slow down. The road ahead changes direction at an extreme angle.

column2: 33. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: there is a reduction of lanes ahead.
column6: a divided highway ends ahead.
column8: they must stay on the right side of the divider
column10: there is a right turn ahead.

column2: 34. Drivers should use the horn:
column4: if a driver is moving slowly, and you want them to drive faster.
column6: to alert other drivers that they made a mistake.
column8: when feeling angry or upset.
column10: only when necessary, to avoid collisions.

column2: 35. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.
column6: green; white
column8: yellow; black

column2: 36. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: Drivers may move forward with caution.

column2: 37. These are:
column6: route signs.
column8: miles-left signs.

column2: 38. This sign means:
column6: Wrong way; Turn around immediately.
column8: 270 degree turn ahead.

column2: 39. This road sign means:
column6: Side Road
column8: Stop ahead

column2: 40. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.
column6: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column8: All of the above.
column10: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
